The Loudoun County public school system: Seuss and his books are no longer the emphasis of Read Across America Day in their schools, citing research on racial undertones in his work.
The school system clarified that Dr: Seuss' books have not been banned or limited in any way and remain available to students in libraries and classrooms.
The report claiming that Loudoun County: canceled" Dr. Seuss was based on the fact that the school system decided not to highlight or focus on his work for this year's Read Across America Day, despite the holiday being inspired by his work and occurring on his birthday.
The National Education Association: NEA), which organizes Read Across America Day, has transitioned the event to be independent of any specific book, publisher, or character, ending their partnership with Dr. Seuss Enterprises.
